inkball

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • inkball.GameObject
      • inkball.Ball

  • public class Ball
extends GameObject
    The ball class inherits from the abstract GameObject class. Ball class represents the ball object in the game. The ball object interacts with the wall and the hole objects in the game, as well as spawned from the spawner object. The ball object is responsible for moving, checking for collisions, reflecting off walls, and changing colour when colliding with coloured walls.

      • Fields inherited from class inkball.GameObject

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ball

        public Ball(int x,
            int y,
            processing.core.PApplet app,
            java.lang.String ballColour)
        Constructor for the Ball object. The ball object is created with a given position, colour, and board object. The ball object is initialised with a random velocity and is set to be active.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the ball
        y - The y-coordinate of the ball
        app - The PApplet object
        ballColour - The colour of the ball

      • move

        public void move()
        Move the ball by updating its position based on its velocity. The method also checks for border collisions and reflects the ball if it collides with the wall.

      • checkBorderCollision

        public void checkBorderCollision()
        Check if the ball collides with the borders of the game window. If the ball collides with the left or right border, the x-component of the velocity is reversed. If the ball collides with the top or bottom border, the y-component of the velocity is reversed.

      • checkCollisionWithWall

        public boolean checkCollisionWithWall(LineSegment[] hitbox,
                                      processing.core.PApplet app)
        Check if the ball collides with the wall hitbox. The method checks each line segment of the wall hitbox and reflects the ball upon collision.
        Parameters:
        hitbox - The wall hitbox
        app - The PApplet object
        Returns:
        True if the ball collides with the wall, false otherwise

      • isCollidingWithLine

        public boolean isCollidingWithLine(LineSegment line)
        Check if the ball is colliding with a line segment. The method calculates the distance between the ball's predicted position in the next frame and the line segment. If the sum of the distances from the ball to the line segment's end points is less than the line segment's length plus the ball's radius, the ball is colliding with the line segment.
        Parameters:
        line - The line segment to check for collision
        Returns:
        True if the ball is colliding with the line segment, false otherwise

      • reflectBallLine

        public void reflectBallLine(processing.core.PVector[] hitbox)
        Reflect the ball from the line segment. The method calculates the normal vector of the line segment and reflects the ball's velocity based on the normal vector.
        Parameters:
        hitbox - The line segment to reflect the ball from

      • reflectBallWall

        public void reflectBallWall(processing.core.PVector[] hitbox)
        Reflect the ball from the wall. The method calculates the normal vector of the wall edge and reflects the ball's velocity based on the normal vector.
        Parameters:
        hitbox - The wall hitbox

      • changeColour

        public void changeColour(Tile wallTile)
        Change the colour of the ball based on the wall tile it collides with. The method changes the ball's colour and image based on the wall tile type.
        Parameters:
        wallTile - The wall tile the ball collides with

      • isCollidingWithLine

                                   processing.core.PVector futurePosition,
                                   float radius)
        Check if the ball is colliding with a line segment. The method calculates the
        Parameters:
        line - The line segment to check for collision
        futurePosition - The future position of the ball
        radius - The radius of the ball
        Returns:
        True if the ball is colliding with the line segment, false otherwise

      • calculateNormalVector

        public processing.core.PVector calculateNormalVector(LineSegment line)
        Calculate the normal vector of the line segment. The method calculates two normal vectors and chooses the normal vector that is closer to the ball.
        Parameters:
        line - The line segment to calculate the normal vector
        Returns:
        The normal vector of the line segment

        Parameters:
